newsitem.title: USA: Brooktrout says it won't meet Q2 estimates.
newsitem.headline: Brooktrout says it won't meet Q2 estimates.

text.p: Brooktrout Technology Inc said on Monday it will not meet analysts' earnings or revenue expectations in the second quarter.
Sales have been lower than anticipated during the quarter and only a modest increase is expected over the previous year's comparable quarter, Brooktrout said in a statement.
Brooktrout will report its financial results for the quarter ending June 30, 1997, on or about July 31, 1997.
Earnings estimates for the company were not immediately available.
Also, Brooktrout said it has acquired Netaccess, a Xircom Inc subsidiary, for $11 million and the assumption of certain liabilities.
Brooktrout expects to record an after tax charge of $2.2 million to $2.5 million for the write-off of in-process research and development.
